PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: WILLIAM PAGE, a boy, son to Page.
SIR HUGH EVANS, a Welsh parson.
MISTRESS QUICKLY, servant to Doctor Caius.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Windsor. Before PAGE's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter SHALLOW, SLENDER, and SIR HUGH EVANS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Sir Hugh, persuade me not; I will make a Star-
chamber matter of it: if he were twenty Sir John
Falstaffs, he shall not abuse Robert Shallow, esquire.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: In the county of Gloucester, justice of peace and
'Coram.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, cousin Slender, and 'Custalourum.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, and 'Rato-lorum' too; and a gentleman born,
master parson; who writes himself 'Armigero,' in any
bill, warrant, quittance, or obligation, 'Armigero.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, that I do; and have done any time these three
hundred years.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: All his successors gone before him hath done't; and
all his ancestors that come after him may: they may
give the dozen white luces in their coat.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: It is an old coat.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: The dozen white louses do become an old coat well;
it agrees well, passant; it is a familiar beast to
man, and signifies love.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: The luce is the fresh fish; the salt fish is an old coat.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I may quarter, coz.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: You may, by marrying.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: It is marring indeed, if he quarter it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Not a whit.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Yes, py'r lady; if he has a quarter of your coat,
there is but three skirts for yourself, in my
simple conjectures: but that is all one. If Sir
John Falstaff have committed disparagements unto
you, I am of the church, and will be glad to do my
benevolence to make atonements and compremises
between you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: The council shall bear it; it is a riot.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: It is not meet the council hear a riot; there is no
fear of Got in a riot: the council, look you, shall
desire to hear the fear of Got, and not to hear a
riot; take your vizaments in that.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Ha! o' my life, if I were young again, the sword
should end it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: It is petter that friends is the sword, and end it:
and there is also another device in my prain, which
peradventure prings goot discretions with it: there
is Anne Page, which is daughter to Master Thomas
Page, which is pretty virginity.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Mistress Anne Page? She has brown hair, and speaks
small like a woman.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: It is that fery person for all the orld, as just as
you will desire; and seven hundred pounds of moneys,
and gold and silver, is her grandsire upon his
death's-bed--Got deliver to a joyful resurrections!
--give, when she is able to overtake seventeen years
old: it were a goot motion if we leave our pribbles
and prabbles, and desire a marriage between Master
Abraham and Mistress Anne Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Did her grandsire leave her seven hundred pound?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, and her father is make her a petter penny.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I know the young gentlewoman; she has good gifts.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Seven hundred pounds and possibilities is goot gifts.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Well, let us see honest Master Page. Is Falstaff there?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Shall I tell you a lie? I do despise a liar as I do
despise one that is false, or as I despise one that
is not true. The knight, Sir John, is there; and, I
beseech you, be ruled by your well-willers. I will
peat the door for Master Page.
What, hoa! Got pless your house here!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Within Who's there?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Here is Got's plessing, and your friend, and Justice
Shallow; and here young Master Slender, that
peradventures shall tell you another tale, if
matters grow to your likings.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I am glad to see your worships well.
I thank you for my venison, Master Shallow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Master Page, I am glad to see you: much good do it
your good heart! I wished your venison better; it
was ill killed. How doth good Mistress Page?--and I
thank you always with my heart, la! with my heart.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, I thank you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, I thank you; by yea and no, I do.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I am glad to see you, good Master Slender.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: How does your fallow greyhound, sir? I heard say he
was outrun on Cotsall.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: It could not be judged, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: You'll not confess, you'll not confess.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: That he will not. 'Tis your fault, 'tis your fault;
'tis a good dog.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: A cur, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, he's a good dog, and a fair dog: can there be
more said? he is good and fair. Is Sir John
Falstaff here?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, he is within; and I would I could do a good
office between you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: It is spoke as a Christians ought to speak.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: He hath wronged me, Master Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, he doth in some sort confess it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: If it be confessed, it is not redress'd: is not that
so, Master Page? He hath wronged me; indeed he
hath, at a word, he hath, believe me: Robert
Shallow, esquire, saith, he is wronged.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Here comes Sir John.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter FALSTAFF, BARDOLPH, NYM, and PISTOL

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Now, Master Shallow, you'll complain of me to the king?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Knight, you have beaten my men, killed my deer, and
broke open my lodge.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: But not kissed your keeper's daughter?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Tut, a pin! this shall be answered.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I will answer it straight; I have done all this.
That is now answered.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: The council shall know this.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: 'Twere better for you if it were known in counsel:
you'll be laughed at.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Pauca verba, Sir John; goot worts.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Good worts! good cabbage. Slender, I broke your
head: what matter have you against me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, sir, I have matter in my head against you;
and against your cony-catching rascals, Bardolph,
Nym, and Pistol.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BARDOLPH
SPEECH.LINE: You Banbury cheese!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, it is no matter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: How now, Mephostophilus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, it is no matter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: Slice, I say! pauca, pauca: slice! that's my humour.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Where's Simple, my man? Can you tell, cousin?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Peace, I pray you. Now let us understand. There is
three umpires in this matter, as I understand; that
is, Master Page, fidelicet Master Page; and there is
myself, fidelicet myself; and the three party is,
lastly and finally, mine host of the Garter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: We three, to hear it and end it between them.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Fery goot: I will make a prief of it in my note-
book; and we will afterwards ork upon the cause with
as great discreetly as we can.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Pistol!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: He hears with ears.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: The tevil and his tam! what phrase is this, 'He
hears with ear'? why, it is affectations.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Pistol, did you pick Master Slender's purse?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, by these gloves, did he, or I would I might
never come in mine own great chamber again else, of
seven groats in mill-sixpences, and two Edward
shovel-boards, that cost me two shilling and two
pence apiece of Yead Miller, by these gloves.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Is this true, Pistol?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: No; it is false, if it is a pick-purse.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Ha, thou mountain-foreigner! Sir John and Master mine,
I combat challenge of this latten bilbo.
Word of denial in thy labras here!
Word of denial: froth and scum, thou liest!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: By these gloves, then, 'twas he.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: Be avised, sir, and pass good humours: I will say
'marry trap' with you, if you run the nuthook's
humour on me; that is the very note of it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: By this hat, then, he in the red face had it; for
though I cannot remember what I did when you made me
drunk, yet I am not altogether an ass.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: What say you, Scarlet and John?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BARDOLPH
SPEECH.LINE: Why, sir, for my part I say the gentleman had drunk
himself out of his five sentences.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: It is his five senses: fie, what the ignorance is!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BARDOLPH
SPEECH.LINE: And being fap, sir, was, as they say, cashiered; and
so conclusions passed the careires.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, you spake in Latin then too; but 'tis no
matter: I'll ne'er be drunk whilst I live again,
but in honest, civil, godly company, for this trick:
if I be drunk, I'll be drunk with those that have
the fear of God, and not with drunken knaves.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: So Got udge me, that is a virtuous mind.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: You hear all these matters denied, gentlemen; you hear it.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter ANNE PAGE, with wine; MISTRESS FORD and MISTRESS PAGE, following

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, daughter, carry the wine in; we'll drink within.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: O heaven! this is Mistress Anne Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: How now, Mistress Ford!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Mistress Ford, by my troth, you are very well met:
by your leave, good mistress.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Wife, bid these gentlemen welcome. Come, we have a
hot venison pasty to dinner: come, gentlemen, I hope
we shall drink down all unkindness.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt all except SHALLOW, SLENDER, and SIR HUGH EVANS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I had rather than forty shillings I had my Book of
Songs and Sonnets here.
How now, Simple! where have you been? I must wait
on myself, must I? You have not the Book of Riddles
about you, have you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Book of Riddles! why, did you not lend it to Alice
Shortcake upon All-hallowmas last, a fortnight
afore Michaelmas?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Come, coz; come, coz; we stay for you. A word with
you, coz; marry, this, coz: there is, as 'twere, a
tender, a kind of tender, made afar off by Sir Hugh
here. Do you understand me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, sir, you shall find me reasonable; if it be so,
I shall do that that is reason.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, but understand me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: So I do, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Give ear to his motions, Master Slender: I will
description the matter to you, if you be capacity of it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I will do as my cousin Shallow says: I pray
you, pardon me; he's a justice of peace in his
country, simple though I stand here.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: But that is not the question: the question is
concerning your marriage.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, there's the point, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, is it; the very point of it; to Mistress Anne Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Why, if it be so, I will marry her upon any
reasonable demands.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: But can you affection the 'oman? Let us command to
know that of your mouth or of your lips; for divers
philosophers hold that the lips is parcel of the
mouth. Therefore, precisely, can you carry your
good will to the maid?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Cousin Abraham Slender, can you love her?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I hope, sir, I will do as it shall become one that
would do reason.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, Got's lords and his ladies! you must speak
possitable, if you can carry her your desires
towards her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: That you must. Will you, upon good dowry, marry her?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I will do a greater thing than that, upon your
request, cousin, in any reason.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, conceive me, conceive me, sweet coz: what I do
is to pleasure you, coz. Can you love the maid?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I will marry her, sir, at your request: but if there
be no great love in the beginning, yet heaven may
decrease it upon better acquaintance, when we are
married and have more occasion to know one another;
I hope, upon familiarity will grow more contempt:
but if you say, 'Marry her,' I will marry her; that
I am freely dissolved, and dissolutely.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: It is a fery discretion answer; save the fall is in
the ort 'dissolutely:' the ort is, according to our
meaning, 'resolutely:' his meaning is good.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, I think my cousin meant well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, or else I would I might be hanged, la!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Here comes fair Mistress Anne.
Would I were young for your sake, Mistress Anne!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: The dinner is on the table; my father desires your
worships' company.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: I will wait on him, fair Mistress Anne.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Od's plessed will! I will not be absence at the grace.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt SHALLOW and SIR HUGH EVANS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Will't please your worship to come in, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: No, I thank you, forsooth, heartily; I am very well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: The dinner attends you, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I am not a-hungry, I thank you, forsooth. Go,
sirrah, for all you are my man, go wait upon my
cousin Shallow.
A justice of peace sometimes may be beholding to his
friend for a man. I keep but three men and a boy
yet, till my mother be dead: but what though? Yet I
live like a poor gentleman born.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I may not go in without your worship: they will not
sit till you come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I' faith, I'll eat nothing; I thank you as much as
though I did.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I pray you, sir, walk in.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I had rather walk here, I thank you. I bruised
my shin th' other day with playing at sword and
dagger with a master of fence; three veneys for a
dish of stewed prunes; and, by my troth, I cannot
abide the smell of hot meat since. Why do your
dogs bark so? be there bears i' the town?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I think there are, sir; I heard them talked of.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I love the sport well but I shall as soon quarrel at
it as any man in England. You are afraid, if you see
the bear loose, are you not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, indeed, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: That's meat and drink to me, now. I have seen
Sackerson loose twenty times, and have taken him by
the chain; but, I warrant you, the women have so
cried and shrieked at it, that it passed: but women,
indeed, cannot abide 'em; they are very ill-favored
rough things.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Come, gentle Master Slender, come; we stay for you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I'll eat nothing, I thank you, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: By cock and pie, you shall not choose, sir! come, come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, pray you, lead the way.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Come on, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Mistress Anne, yourself shall go first.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ANNE PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Not I, sir; pray you, keep on.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I'll rather be unmannerly than troublesome.
You do yourself wrong, indeed, la!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The same.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS and SIMPLE

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Go your ways, and ask of Doctor Caius' house which
is the way: and there dwells one Mistress Quickly,
which is in the manner of his nurse, or his dry
nurse, or his cook, or his laundry, his washer, and
his wringer.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Well, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, it is petter yet. Give her this letter; for it
is a 'oman that altogether's acquaintance with
Mistress Anne Page: and the letter is, to desire
and require her to solicit your master's desires to
Mistress Anne Page. I pray you, be gone: I will
make an end of my dinner; there's pippins and cheese to come.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A room in the Garter Inn.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter FALSTAFF, Host, BARDOLPH, NYM, PISTOL, and ROBIN

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Mine host of the Garter!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: What says my bully-rook? speak scholarly and wisely.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Truly, mine host, I must turn away some of my
followers.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Discard, bully Hercules; cashier: let them wag; trot, trot.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I sit at ten pounds a week.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Thou'rt an emperor, Caesar, Keisar, and Pheezar. I
will entertain Bardolph; he shall draw, he shall
tap: said I well, bully Hector?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Do so, good mine host.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: I have spoke; let him follow.
Let me see thee froth and lime: I am at a word; follow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Bardolph, follow him. A tapster is a good trade:
an old cloak makes a new jerkin; a withered
serving-man a fresh tapster. Go; adieu.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BARDOLPH
SPEECH.LINE: It is a life that I have desired: I will thrive.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: O base Hungarian wight! wilt thou the spigot wield?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: He was gotten in drink: is not the humour conceited?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I am glad I am so acquit of this tinderbox: his
thefts were too open; his filching was like an
unskilful singer; he kept not time.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: The good humour is to steal at a minute's rest.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: 'Convey,' the wise it call. 'Steal!' foh! a fico
for the phrase!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Well, sirs, I am almost out at heels.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Why, then, let kibes ensue.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: There is no remedy; I must cony-catch; I must shift.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Young ravens must have food.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Which of you know Ford of this town?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: I ken the wight: he is of substance good.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: My honest lads, I will tell you what I am about.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Two yards, and more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: No quips now, Pistol! Indeed, I am in the waist two
yards about; but I am now about no waste; I am about
thrift. Briefly, I do mean to make love to Ford's
wife: I spy entertainment in her; she discourses,
she carves, she gives the leer of invitation: I
can construe the action of her familiar style; and
the hardest voice of her behavior, to be Englished
rightly, is, 'I am Sir John Falstaff's.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: He hath studied her will, and translated her will,
out of honesty into English.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: The anchor is deep: will that humour pass?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Now, the report goes she has all the rule of her
husband's purse: he hath a legion of angels.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: As many devils entertain; and 'To her, boy,' say I.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: The humour rises; it is good: humour me the angels.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I have writ me here a letter to her: and here
another to Page's wife, who even now gave me good
eyes too, examined my parts with most judicious
oeillades; sometimes the beam of her view gilded my
foot, sometimes my portly belly.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Then did the sun on dunghill shine.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: I thank thee for that humour.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: O, she did so course o'er my exteriors with such a
greedy intention, that the appetite of her eye did
seem to scorch me up like a burning-glass! Here's
another letter to her: she bears the purse too; she
is a region in Guiana, all gold and bounty. I will
be cheater to them both, and they shall be
exchequers to me; they shall be my East and West
Indies, and I will trade to them both. Go bear thou
this letter to Mistress Page; and thou this to
Mistress Ford: we will thrive, lads, we will thrive.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Shall I Sir Pandarus of Troy become,
And by my side wear steel? then, Lucifer take all!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: I will run no base humour: here, take the
humour-letter: I will keep the havior of reputation.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: To ROBIN Hold, sirrah, bear you these letters tightly;
Sail like my pinnace to these golden shores.
Rogues, hence, avaunt! vanish like hailstones, go;
Trudge, plod away o' the hoof; seek shelter, pack!
Falstaff will learn the humour of the age,
French thrift, you rogues; myself and skirted page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Let vultures gripe thy guts! for gourd and fullam holds,
And high and low beguiles the rich and poor:
Tester I'll have in pouch when thou shalt lack,
Base Phrygian Turk!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: I have operations which be humours of revenge.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Wilt thou revenge?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: By welkin and her star!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: With wit or steel?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: With both the humours, I:
I will discuss the humour of this love to Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: And I to Ford shall eke unfold
How Falstaff, varlet vile,
His dove will prove, his gold will hold,
And his soft couch defile.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: My humour shall not cool: I will incense Page to
deal with poison; I will possess him with
yellowness, for the revolt of mine is dangerous:
that is my true humour.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Thou art the Mars of malecontents: I second thee; troop on.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. A room in DOCTOR CAIUS' house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY, SIMPLE, and RUGBY

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: What, John Rugby! I pray thee, go to the casement,
and see if you can see my master, Master Doctor
Caius, coming. If he do, i' faith, and find any
body in the house, here will be an old abusing of
God's patience and the king's English.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: I'll go watch.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Go; and we'll have a posset for't soon at night, in
faith, at the latter end of a sea-coal fire.
An honest, willing, kind fellow, as ever servant
shall come in house withal, and, I warrant you, no
tell-tale nor no breed-bate: his worst fault is,
that he is given to prayer; he is something peevish
that way: but nobody but has his fault; but let
that pass. Peter Simple, you say your name is?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, for fault of a better.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: And Master Slender's your master?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, forsooth.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Does he not wear a great round beard, like a
glover's paring-knife?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: No, forsooth: he hath but a little wee face, with a
little yellow beard, a Cain-coloured beard.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: A softly-sprighted man, is he not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, forsooth: but he is as tall a man of his hands
as any is between this and his head; he hath fought
with a warrener.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: How say you? O, I should remember him: does he not
hold up his head, as it were, and strut in his gait?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Yes, indeed, does he.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Well, heaven send Anne Page no worse fortune! Tell
Master Parson Evans I will do what I can for your
master: Anne is a good girl, and I wish--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: Out, alas! here comes my master.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: We shall all be shent. Run in here, good young man;
go into this closet: he will not stay long.
What, John Rugby! John! what, John, I say!
Go, John, go inquire for my master; I doubt
he be not well, that he comes not home.
And down, down, adown-a, &c.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Vat is you sing? I do not like des toys. Pray you,
go and vetch me in my closet un boitier vert, a box,
a green-a box: do intend vat I speak? a green-a box.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, forsooth; I'll fetch it you.
I am glad he went not in himself: if he had found
the young man, he would have been horn-mad.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Fe, fe, fe, fe! ma foi, il fait fort chaud. Je
m'en vais a la cour--la grande affaire.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Is it this, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Oui; mette le au mon pocket: depeche, quickly. Vere
is dat knave Rugby?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: What, John Rugby! John!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: Here, sir!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: You are John Rugby, and you are Jack Rugby. Come,
take-a your rapier, and come after my heel to the court.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis ready, sir, here in the porch.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By my trot, I tarry too long. Od's me!
Qu'ai-j'oublie! dere is some simples in my closet,
dat I vill not for the varld I shall leave behind.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Ay me, he'll find the young man here, and be mad!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: O diable, diable! vat is in my closet? Villain! larron!
Rugby, my rapier!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Good master, be content.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Wherefore shall I be content-a?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: The young man is an honest man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: What shall de honest man do in my closet? dere is
no honest man dat shall come in my closet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: I beseech you, be not so phlegmatic. Hear the truth
of it: he came of an errand to me from Parson Hugh.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Vell.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, forsooth; to desire her to--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Peace, I pray you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Peace-a your tongue. Speak-a your tale.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: To desire this honest gentlewoman, your maid, to
speak a good word to Mistress Anne Page for my
master in the way of marriage.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: This is all, indeed, la! but I'll ne'er put my
finger in the fire, and need not.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Sir Hugh send-a you? Rugby, baille me some paper.
Tarry you a little-a while.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to SIMPLE I am glad he is so quiet: if he
had been thoroughly moved, you should have heard him
so loud and so melancholy. But notwithstanding,
man, I'll do you your master what good I can: and
the very yea and the no is, the French doctor, my
master,--I may call him my master, look you, for I
keep his house; and I wash, wring, brew, bake,
scour, dress meat and drink, make the beds and do
all myself,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to MISTRESS QUICKLY 'Tis a great charge to
come under one body's hand.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to SIMPLE Are you avised o' that? you
shall find it a great charge: and to be up early
and down late; but notwithstanding,--to tell you in
your ear; I would have no words of it,--my master
himself is in love with Mistress Anne Page: but
notwithstanding that, I know Anne's mind,--that's
neither here nor there.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: You jack'nape, give-a this letter to Sir Hugh; by
gar, it is a shallenge: I will cut his troat in dee
park; and I will teach a scurvy jack-a-nape priest
to meddle or make. You may be gone; it is not good
you tarry here. By gar, I will cut all his two
stones; by gar, he shall not have a stone to throw
at his dog:

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, he speaks but for his friend.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: It is no matter-a ver dat: do not you tell-a me
dat I shall have Anne Page for myself? By gar, I
vill kill de Jack priest; and I have appointed mine
host of de Jarteer to measure our weapon. By gar, I
will myself have Anne Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, the maid loves you, and all shall be well. We
must give folks leave to prate: what, the good-jer!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Rugby, come to the court with me. By gar, if I have
not Anne Page, I shall turn your head out of my
door. Follow my heels, Rugby.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: You shall have An fool's-head of your own. No, I
know Anne's mind for that: never a woman in Windsor
knows more of Anne's mind than I do; nor can do more
than I do with her, I thank heaven.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FENTON
SPEECH.LINE: Within Who's within there? ho!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Who's there, I trow! Come near the house, I pray you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FENTON
SPEECH.LINE: How now, good woman? how dost thou?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: The better that it pleases your good worship to ask.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FENTON
SPEECH.LINE: What news? how does pretty Mistress Anne?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: In truth, sir, and she is pretty, and honest, and
gentle; and one that is your friend, I can tell you
that by the way; I praise heaven for it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FENTON
SPEECH.LINE: Shall I do any good, thinkest thou? shall I not lose my suit?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Troth, sir, all is in his hands above: but
notwithstanding, Master Fenton, I'll be sworn on a
book, she loves you. Have not your worship a wart
above your eye?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FENTON
SPEECH.LINE: Yes, marry, have I; what of that?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Well, thereby hangs a tale: good faith, it is such
another Nan; but, I detest, an honest maid as ever
broke bread: we had an hour's talk of that wart. I
shall never laugh but in that maid's company! But
indeed she is given too much to allicholy and
musing: but for you--well, go to.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FENTON
SPEECH.LINE: Well, I shall see her to-day. Hold, there's money
for thee; let me have thy voice in my behalf: if
thou seest her before me, commend me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Will I? i'faith, that we will; and I will tell your
worship more of the wart the next time we have
confidence; and of other wooers.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FENTON
SPEECH.LINE: Well, farewell; I am in great haste now.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell to your worship.
Truly, an honest gentleman: but Anne loves him not;
for I know Anne's mind as well as another does. Out
upon't! what have I forgot?

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Before PAGE'S house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MISTRESS PAGE, with a letter

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: What, have I scaped love-letters in the holiday-
time of my beauty, and am I now a subject for them?
Let me see.
'Ask me no reason why I love you; for though
Love use Reason for his physician, he admits him
not for his counsellor. You are not young, no more
am I; go to then, there's sympathy: you are merry,
so am I; ha, ha! then there's more sympathy: you
love sack, and so do I; would you desire better
sympathy? Let it suffice thee, Mistress Page,--at
the least, if the love of soldier can suffice,--
that I love thee. I will not say, pity me; 'tis
not a soldier-like phrase: but I say, love me. By me,
Thine own true knight,
By day or night,
Or any kind of light,
With all his might
For thee to fight, JOHN FALSTAFF'
What a Herod of Jewry is this! O wicked
world! One that is well-nigh worn to pieces with
age to show himself a young gallant! What an
unweighed behavior hath this Flemish drunkard
picked--with the devil's name!--out of my
conversation, that he dares in this manner assay me?
Why, he hath not been thrice in my company! What
should I say to him? I was then frugal of my
mirth: Heaven forgive me! Why, I'll exhibit a bill
in the parliament for the putting down of men. How
shall I be revenged on him? for revenged I will be,
as sure as his guts are made of puddings.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Mistress Page! trust me, I was going to your house.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: And, trust me, I was coming to you. You look very
ill.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I'll ne'er believe that; I have to show to the contrary.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Faith, but you do, in my mind.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Well, I do then; yet I say I could show you to the
contrary. O Mistress Page, give me some counsel!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: What's the matter, woman?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: O woman, if it were not for one trifling respect, I
could come to such honour!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Hang the trifle, woman! take the honour. What is
it? dispense with trifles; what is it?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: If I would but go to hell for an eternal moment or so,
I could be knighted.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: What? thou liest! Sir Alice Ford! These knights
will hack; and so thou shouldst not alter the
article of thy gentry.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: We burn daylight: here, read, read; perceive how I
might be knighted. I shall think the worse of fat
men, as long as I have an eye to make difference of
men's liking: and yet he would not swear; praised
women's modesty; and gave such orderly and
well-behaved reproof to all uncomeliness, that I
would have sworn his disposition would have gone to
the truth of his words; but they do no more adhere
and keep place together than the Hundredth Psalm to
the tune of 'Green Sleeves.' What tempest, I trow,
threw this whale, with so many tuns of oil in his
belly, ashore at Windsor? How shall I be revenged
on him? I think the best way were to entertain him
with hope, till the wicked fire of lust have melted
him in his own grease. Did you ever hear the like?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Letter for letter, but that the name of Page and
Ford differs! To thy great comfort in this mystery
of ill opinions, here's the twin-brother of thy
letter: but let thine inherit first; for, I
protest, mine never shall. I warrant he hath a
thousand of these letters, writ with blank space for
different names--sure, more,--and these are of the
second edition: he will print them, out of doubt;
for he cares not what he puts into the press, when
he would put us two. I had rather be a giantess,
and lie under Mount Pelion. Well, I will find you
twenty lascivious turtles ere one chaste man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Why, this is the very same; the very hand, the very
words. What doth he think of us?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I know not: it makes me almost ready to
wrangle with mine own honesty. I'll entertain
myself like one that I am not acquainted withal;
for, sure, unless he know some strain in me, that I
know not myself, he would never have boarded me in this fury.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: 'Boarding,' call you it? I'll be sure to keep him
above deck.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: So will I if he come under my hatches, I'll never
to sea again. Let's be revenged on him: let's
appoint him a meeting; give him a show of comfort in
his suit and lead him on with a fine-baited delay,
till he hath pawned his horses to mine host of the Garter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I will consent to act any villany against him,
that may not sully the chariness of our honesty. O,
that my husband saw this letter! it would give
eternal food to his jealousy.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Why, look where he comes; and my good man too: he's
as far from jealousy as I am from giving him cause;
and that I hope is an unmeasurable distance.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: You are the happier woman.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Let's consult together against this greasy knight.
Come hither.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter FORD with PISTOL, and PAGE with NYM

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Well, I hope it be not so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Hope is a curtal dog in some affairs:
Sir John affects thy wife.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Why, sir, my wife is not young.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: He wooes both high and low, both rich and poor,
Both young and old, one with another, Ford;
He loves the gallimaufry: Ford, perpend.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Love my wife!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: With liver burning hot. Prevent, or go thou,
Like Sir Actaeon he, with Ringwood at thy heels:
O, odious is the name!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: What name, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: The horn, I say. Farewell.
Take heed, have open eye, for thieves do foot by night:
Take heed, ere summer comes or cuckoo-birds do sing.
Away, Sir Corporal Nym!
Believe it, Page; he speaks sense.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Aside I will be patient; I will find out this.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: NYM
SPEECH.LINE: To PAGE And this is true; I like not the humour
of lying. He hath wronged me in some humours: I
should have borne the humoured letter to her; but I
have a sword and it shall bite upon my necessity.
He loves your wife; there's the short and the long.
My name is Corporal Nym; I speak and I avouch; 'tis
true: my name is Nym and Falstaff loves your wife.
Adieu. I love not the humour of bread and cheese,
and there's the humour of it. Adieu.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: 'The humour of it,' quoth a'! here's a fellow
frights English out of his wits.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I will seek out Falstaff.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I never heard such a drawling, affecting rogue.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: If I do find it: well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I will not believe such a Cataian, though the priest
o' the town commended him for a true man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: 'Twas a good sensible fellow: well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: How now, Meg!

SCENE.STAGEDIR: MISTRESS PAGE and MISTRESS FORD come forward

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Whither go you, George? Hark you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: How now, sweet Frank! why art thou melancholy?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I melancholy! I am not melancholy. Get you home, go.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Faith, thou hast some crotchets in thy head. Now,
will you go, Mistress Page?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Have with you. You'll come to dinner, George.
Look who comes yonder: she shall be our messenger
to this paltry knight.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to MISTRESS PAGE Trust me, I thought on her:
she'll fit it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: You are come to see my daughter Anne?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, forsooth; and, I pray, how does good Mistress Anne?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Go in with us and see: we have an hour's talk with
you.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS FORD, and MISTRESS QUICKLY

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: How now, Master Ford!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: You heard what this knave told me, did you not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Yes: and you heard what the other told me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Do you think there is truth in them?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Hang 'em, slaves! I do not think the knight would
offer it: but these that accuse him in his intent
towards our wives are a yoke of his discarded men;
very rogues, now they be out of service.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Were they his men?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, were they.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I like it never the better for that. Does he lie at
the Garter?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, marry, does he. If he should intend this voyage
towards my wife, I would turn her loose to him; and
what he gets more of her than sharp words, let it
lie on my head.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I do not misdoubt my wife; but I would be loath to
turn them together. A man may be too confident: I
would have nothing lie on my head: I cannot be thus satisfied.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Look where my ranting host of the Garter comes:
there is either liquor in his pate or money in his
purse when he looks so merrily.
How now, mine host!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: How now, bully-rook! thou'rt a gentleman.
Cavaleiro-justice, I say!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: I follow, mine host, I follow. Good even and
twenty, good Master Page! Master Page, will you go
with us? we have sport in hand.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Tell him, cavaleiro-justice; tell him, bully-rook.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, there is a fray to be fought between Sir Hugh
the Welsh priest and Caius the French doctor.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Good mine host o' the Garter, a word with you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: What sayest thou, my bully-rook?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: To PAGE Will you go with us to behold it? My
merry host hath had the measuring of their weapons;
and, I think, hath appointed them contrary places;
for, believe me, I hear the parson is no jester.
Hark, I will tell you what our sport shall be.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Hast thou no suit against my knight, my
guest-cavaleire?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: None, I protest: but I'll give you a pottle of
burnt sack to give me recourse to him and tell him
my name is Brook; only for a jest.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: My hand, bully; thou shalt have egress and regress;
--said I well?--and thy name shall be Brook. It is
a merry knight. Will you go, An-heires?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Have with you, mine host.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I have heard the Frenchman hath good skill in
his rapier.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Tut, sir, I could have told you more. In these times
you stand on distance, your passes, stoccadoes, and
I know not what: 'tis the heart, Master Page; 'tis
here, 'tis here. I have seen the time, with my long
sword I would have made you four tall fellows skip like rats.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Here, boys, here, here! shall we wag?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Have with you. I would rather hear them scold than fight.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Though Page be a secure fool, an stands so firmly
on his wife's frailty, yet I cannot put off my
opinion so easily: she was in his company at Page's
house; and what they made there, I know not. Well,
I will look further into't: and I have a disguise
to sound Falstaff. If I find her honest, I lose not
my labour; if she be otherwise, 'tis labour well bestowed.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A room in the Garter Inn.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I will not lend thee a penny.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Why, then the world's mine oyster.
Which I with sword will open.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Not a penny. I have been content, sir, you should
lay my countenance to pawn; I have grated upon my
good friends for three reprieves for you and your
coach-fellow Nym; or else you had looked through
the grate, like a geminy of baboons. I am damned in
hell for swearing to gentlemen my friends, you were
good soldiers and tall fellows; and when Mistress
Bridget lost the handle of her fan, I took't upon
mine honour thou hadst it not.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: Didst not thou share? hadst thou not fifteen pence?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Reason, you rogue, reason: thinkest thou I'll
endanger my soul gratis? At a word, hang no more
about me, I am no gibbet for you. Go. A short knife
and a throng! To your manor of Pickt-hatch! Go.
You'll not bear a letter for me, you rogue! you
stand upon your honour! Why, thou unconfinable
baseness, it is as much as I can do to keep the
terms of my honour precise: I, I, I myself
sometimes, leaving the fear of God on the left hand
and hiding mine honour in my necessity, am fain to
shuffle, to hedge and to lurch; and yet you, rogue,
will ensconce your rags, your cat-a-mountain
looks, your red-lattice phrases, and your
bold-beating oaths, under the shelter of your
honour! You will not do it, you!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: I do relent: what would thou more of man?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROBIN
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, here's a woman would speak with you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Let her approach.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Give your worship good morrow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Good morrow, good wife.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Not so, an't please your worship.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Good maid, then.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: I'll be sworn,
As my mother was, the first hour I was born.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I do believe the swearer. What with me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Shall I vouchsafe your worship a word or two?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Two thousand, fair woman: and I'll vouchsafe thee
the hearing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: There is one Mistress Ford, sir:--I pray, come a
little nearer this ways:--I myself dwell with master
Doctor Caius,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Well, on: Mistress Ford, you say,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Your worship says very true: I pray your worship,
come a little nearer this ways.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I warrant thee, nobody hears; mine own people, mine
own people.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Are they so? God bless them and make them his servants!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Well, Mistress Ford; what of her?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Why, sir, she's a good creature. Lord Lord! your
worship's a wanton! Well, heaven forgive you and all
of us, I pray!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Mistress Ford; come, Mistress Ford,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, this is the short and the long of it; you
have brought her into such a canaries as 'tis
wonderful. The best courtier of them all, when the
court lay at Windsor, could never have brought her
to such a canary. Yet there has been knights, and
lords, and gentlemen, with their coaches, I warrant
you, coach after coach, letter after letter, gift
after gift; smelling so sweetly, all musk, and so
rushling, I warrant you, in silk and gold; and in
such alligant terms; and in such wine and sugar of
the best and the fairest, that would have won any
woman's heart; and, I warrant you, they could never
get an eye-wink of her: I had myself twenty angels
given me this morning; but I defy all angels, in
any such sort, as they say, but in the way of
honesty: and, I warrant you, they could never get
her so much as sip on a cup with the proudest of
them all: and yet there has been earls, nay, which
is more, pensioners; but, I warrant you, all is one with her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: But what says she to me? be brief, my good
she-Mercury.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, she hath received your letter, for the which
she thanks you a thousand times; and she gives you
to notify that her husband will be absence from his
house between ten and eleven.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Ten and eleven?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, forsooth; and then you may come and see the
picture, she says, that you wot of: Master Ford,
her husband, will be from home. Alas! the sweet
woman leads an ill life with him: he's a very
jealousy man: she leads a very frampold life with
him, good heart.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Ten and eleven. Woman, commend me to her; I will
not fail her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Why, you say well. But I have another messenger to
your worship. Mistress Page hath her hearty
commendations to you too: and let me tell you in
your ear, she's as fartuous a civil modest wife, and
one, I tell you, that will not miss you morning nor
evening prayer, as any is in Windsor, whoe'er be the
other: and she bade me tell your worship that her
husband is seldom from home; but she hopes there
will come a time. I never knew a woman so dote upon
a man: surely I think you have charms, la; yes, in truth.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Not I, I assure thee: setting the attractions of my
good parts aside I have no other charms.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Blessing on your heart for't!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: But, I pray thee, tell me this: has Ford's wife and
Page's wife acquainted each other how they love me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: That were a jest indeed! they have not so little
grace, I hope: that were a trick indeed! but
Mistress Page would desire you to send her your
little page, of all loves: her husband has a
marvellous infection to the little page; and truly
Master Page is an honest man. Never a wife in
Windsor leads a better life than she does: do what
she will, say what she will, take all, pay all, go
to bed when she list, rise when she list, all is as
she will: and truly she deserves it; for if there
be a kind woman in Windsor, she is one. You must
send her your page; no remedy.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Why, I will.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS QUICKLY
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, but do so, then: and, look you, he may come and
go between you both; and in any case have a
nay-word, that you may know one another's mind, and
the boy never need to understand any thing; for
'tis not good that children should know any
wickedness: old folks, you know, have discretion,
as they say, and know the world.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Fare thee well: commend me to them both: there's
my purse; I am yet thy debtor. Boy, go along with
this woman.
This news distracts me!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PISTOL
SPEECH.LINE: This punk is one of Cupid's carriers:
Clap on more sails; pursue; up with your fights:
Give fire: she is my prize, or ocean whelm them all!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Sayest thou so, old Jack? go thy ways; I'll make
more of thy old body than I have done. Will they
yet look after thee? Wilt thou, after the expense
of so much money, be now a gainer? Good body, I
thank thee. Let them say 'tis grossly done; so it be
fairly done, no matter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BARDOLPH
SPEECH.LINE: Sir John, there's one Master Brook below would fain
speak with you, and be acquainted with you; and hath
sent your worship a morning's draught of sack.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Brook is his name?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BARDOLPH
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Call him in.
Such Brooks are welcome to me, that o'erflow such
liquor. Ah, ha! Mistress Ford and Mistress Page
have I encompassed you? go to; via!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Bless you, sir!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: And you, sir! Would you speak with me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I make bold to press with so little preparation upon
you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: You're welcome. What's your will? Give us leave, drawer.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, I am a gentleman that have spent much; my name is Brook.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Good Master Brook, I desire more acquaintance of you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Good Sir John, I sue for yours: not to charge you;
for I must let you understand I think myself in
better plight for a lender than you are: the which
hath something embolden'd me to this unseasoned
intrusion; for they say, if money go before, all
ways do lie open.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Money is a good soldier, sir, and will on.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Troth, and I have a bag of money here troubles me:
if you will help to bear it, Sir John, take all, or
half, for easing me of the carriage.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, I know not how I may deserve to be your porter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I will tell you, sir, if you will give me the hearing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Speak, good Master Brook: I shall be glad to be
your servant.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, I hear you are a scholar,--I will be brief
with you,--and you have been a man long known to me,
though I had never so good means, as desire, to make
myself acquainted with you. I shall discover a
thing to you, wherein I must very much lay open mine
own imperfection: but, good Sir John, as you have
one eye upon my follies, as you hear them unfolded,
turn another into the register of your own; that I
may pass with a reproof the easier, sith you
yourself know how easy it is to be such an offender.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Very well, sir; proceed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: There is a gentlewoman in this town; her husband's
name is Ford.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Well, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I have long loved her, and, I protest to you,
bestowed much on her; followed her with a doting
observance; engrossed opportunities to meet her;
fee'd every slight occasion that could but niggardly
give me sight of her; not only bought many presents
to give her, but have given largely to many to know
what she would have given; briefly, I have pursued
her as love hath pursued me; which hath been on the
wing of all occasions. But whatsoever I have
merited, either in my mind or, in my means, meed,
I am sure, I have received none; unless experience
be a jewel that I have purchased at an infinite
rate, and that hath taught me to say this:
'Love like a shadow flies when substance love pursues;
Pursuing that that flies, and flying what pursues.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Have you received no promise of satisfaction at her hands?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Never.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Have you importuned her to such a purpose?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Never.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Of what quality was your love, then?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Like a fair house built on another man's ground; so
that I have lost my edifice by mistaking the place
where I erected it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: To what purpose have you unfolded this to me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: When I have told you that, I have told you all.
Some say, that though she appear honest to me, yet in
other places she enlargeth her mirth so far that
there is shrewd construction made of her. Now, Sir
John, here is the heart of my purpose: you are a
gentleman of excellent breeding, admirable
discourse, of great admittance, authentic in your
place and person, generally allowed for your many
war-like, court-like, and learned preparations.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: O, sir!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Believe it, for you know it. There is money; spend
it, spend it; spend more; spend all I have; only
give me so much of your time in exchange of it, as
to lay an amiable siege to the honesty of this
Ford's wife: use your art of wooing; win her to
consent to you: if any man may, you may as soon as
any.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Would it apply well to the vehemency of your
affection, that I should win what you would enjoy?
Methinks you prescribe to yourself very preposterously.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: O, understand my drift. She dwells so securely on
the excellency of her honour, that the folly of my
soul dares not present itself: she is too bright to
be looked against. Now, could I could come to her
with any detection in my hand, my desires had
instance and argument to commend themselves: I
could drive her then from the ward of her purity,
her reputation, her marriage-vow, and a thousand
other her defences, which now are too too strongly
embattled against me. What say you to't, Sir John?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Master Brook, I will first make bold with your
money; next, give me your hand; and last, as I am a
gentleman, you shall, if you will, enjoy Ford's wife.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: O good sir!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: I say you shall.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Want no money, Sir John; you shall want none.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Want no Mistress Ford, Master Brook; you shall want
none. I shall be with her, I may tell you, by her
own appointment; even as you came in to me, her
assistant or go-between parted from me: I say I
shall be with her between ten and eleven; for at
that time the jealous rascally knave her husband
will be forth. Come you to me at night; you shall
know how I speed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I am blest in your acquaintance. Do you know Ford,
sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Hang him, poor cuckoldly knave! I know him not:
yet I wrong him to call him poor; they say the
jealous wittolly knave hath masses of money; for the
which his wife seems to me well-favored. I will
use her as the key of the cuckoldly rogue's coffer;
and there's my harvest-home.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I would you knew Ford, sir, that you might avoid him
if you saw him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FALSTAFF
SPEECH.LINE: Hang him, mechanical salt-butter rogue! I will
stare him out of his wits; I will awe him with my
cudgel: it shall hang like a meteor o'er the
cuckold's horns. Master Brook, thou shalt know I
will predominate over the peasant, and thou shalt
lie with his wife. Come to me soon at night.
Ford's a knave, and I will aggravate his style;
thou, Master Brook, shalt know him for knave and
cuckold. Come to me soon at night.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: What a damned Epicurean rascal is this! My heart is
ready to crack with impatience. Who says this is
improvident jealousy? my wife hath sent to him; the
hour is fixed; the match is made. Would any man
have thought this? See the hell of having a false
woman! My bed shall be abused, my coffers
ransacked, my reputation gnawn at; and I shall not
only receive this villanous wrong, but stand under
the adoption of abominable terms, and by him that
does me this wrong. Terms! names! Amaimon sounds
well; Lucifer, well; Barbason, well; yet they are
devils' additions, the names of fiends: but
Cuckold! Wittol!--Cuckold! the devil himself hath
not such a name. Page is an ass, a secure ass: he
will trust his wife; he will not be jealous. I will
rather trust a Fleming with my butter, Parson Hugh
the Welshman with my cheese, an Irishman with my
aqua-vitae bottle, or a thief to walk my ambling
gelding, than my wife with herself; then she plots,
then she ruminates, then she devises; and what they
think in their hearts they may effect, they will
break their hearts but they will effect. God be
praised for my jealousy! Eleven o'clock the hour.
I will prevent this, detect my wife, be revenged on
Falstaff, and laugh at Page. I will about it;
better three hours too soon than a minute too late.
Fie, fie, fie! cuckold! cuckold! cuckold!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A field near Windsor.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Jack Rugby!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: Sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Vat is de clock, Jack?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis past the hour, sir, that Sir Hugh promised to meet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, he has save his soul, dat he is no come; he
has pray his Pible well, dat he is no come: by gar,
Jack Rugby, he is dead already, if he be come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: He is wise, sir; he knew your worship would kill
him, if he came.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, de herring is no dead so as I vill kill him.
Take your rapier, Jack; I vill tell you how I vill kill him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, sir, I cannot fence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Villany, take your rapier.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: RUGBY
SPEECH.LINE: Forbear; here's company.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter Host, SHALLOW, SLENDER, and PAGE

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Bless thee, bully doctor!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Save you, Master Doctor Caius!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Now, good master doctor!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Give you good morrow, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Vat be all you, one, two, tree, four, come for?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: To see thee fight, to see thee foin, to see thee
traverse; to see thee here, to see thee there; to
see thee pass thy punto, thy stock, thy reverse, thy
distance, thy montant. Is he dead, my Ethiopian? is
he dead, my Francisco? ha, bully! What says my
AEsculapius? my Galen? my heart of elder? ha! is
he dead, bully stale? is he dead?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, he is de coward Jack priest of de vorld; he
is not show his face.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Thou art a Castalion-King-Urinal. Hector of Greece, my boy!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I pray you, bear vitness that me have stay six or
seven, two, tree hours for him, and he is no come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: He is the wiser man, master doctor: he is a curer of
souls, and you a curer of bodies; if you should
fight, you go against the hair of your professions.
Is it not true, Master Page?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Master Shallow, you have yourself been a great
fighter, though now a man of peace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Bodykins, Master Page, though I now be old and of
the peace, if I see a sword out, my finger itches to
make one. Though we are justices and doctors and
churchmen, Master Page, we have some salt of our
youth in us; we are the sons of women, Master Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis true, Master Shallow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: It will be found so, Master Page. Master Doctor
Caius, I am come to fetch you home. I am sworn of
the peace: you have showed yourself a wise
physician, and Sir Hugh hath shown himself a wise
and patient churchman. You must go with me, master doctor.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Pardon, guest-justice. A word, Mounseur Mockwater.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Mock-vater! vat is dat?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Mock-water, in our English tongue, is valour, bully.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, den, I have as mush mock-vater as de
Englishman. Scurvy jack-dog priest! by gar, me
vill cut his ears.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: He will clapper-claw thee tightly, bully.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Clapper-de-claw! vat is dat?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: That is, he will make thee amends.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, me do look he shall clapper-de-claw me;
for, by gar, me vill have it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: And I will provoke him to't, or let him wag.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Me tank you for dat.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: And, moreover, bully,--but first, master guest, and
Master Page, and eke Cavaleiro Slender, go you
through the town to Frogmore.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Sir Hugh is there, is he?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: He is there: see what humour he is in; and I will
bring the doctor about by the fields. Will it do well?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: We will do it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SHALLOW
SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Adieu, good master doctor.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, me vill kill de priest; for he speak for a
jack-an-ape to Anne Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Let him die: sheathe thy impatience, throw cold
water on thy choler: go about the fields with me
through Frogmore: I will bring thee where Mistress
Anne Page is, at a farm-house a-feasting; and thou
shalt woo her. Cried I aim? said I well?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, me dank you for dat: by gar, I love you;
and I shall procure-a you de good guest, de earl,
de knight, de lords, de gentlemen, my patients.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: For the which I will be thy adversary toward Anne
Page. Said I well?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, 'tis good; vell said.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Let us wag, then.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Come at my heels, Jack Rugby.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A field near Frogmore.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS and SIMPLE

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: I pray you now, good master Slender's serving-man,
and friend Simple by your name, which way have you
looked for Master Caius, that calls himself doctor of physic?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, sir, the pittie-ward, the park-ward, every
way; old Windsor way, and every way but the town
way.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: I most fehemently desire you you will also look that
way.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: I will, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Pless my soul, how full of chollors I am, and
trempling of mind! I shall be glad if he have
deceived me. How melancholies I am! I will knog
his urinals about his knave's costard when I have
good opportunities for the ork. 'Pless my soul!
To shallow rivers, to whose falls
Melodious birds sings madrigals;
There will we make our peds of roses,
And a thousand fragrant posies.
To shallow--
Mercy on me! I have a great dispositions to cry.
Melodious birds sing madrigals--
When as I sat in Pabylon--
And a thousand vagram posies.
To shallow &c.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: Yonder he is coming, this way, Sir Hugh.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: He's welcome.
To shallow rivers, to whose falls-
Heaven prosper the right! What weapons is he?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIMPLE
SPEECH.LINE: No weapons, sir. There comes my master, Master
Shallow, and another gentleman, from Frogmore, over
the stile, this way.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Pray you, give me my gown; or else keep it in your arms.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: How now, master Parson! Good morrow, good Sir Hugh.
Keep a gamester from the dice, and a good student
from his book, and it is wonderful.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Aside Ah, sweet Anne Page!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: 'Save you, good Sir Hugh!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Pless you from his mercy sake, all of you!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: What, the sword and the word! do you study them
both, master parson?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: And youthful still! in your doublet and hose this
raw rheumatic day!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: There is reasons and causes for it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: We are come to you to do a good office, master parson.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Fery well: what is it?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Yonder is a most reverend gentleman, who, belike
having received wrong by some person, is at most
odds with his own gravity and patience that ever you
saw.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: I have lived fourscore years and upward; I never
heard a man of his place, gravity and learning, so
wide of his own respect.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: What is he?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I think you know him; Master Doctor Caius, the
renowned French physician.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Got's will, and his passion of my heart! I had as
lief you would tell me of a mess of porridge.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Why?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: He has no more knowledge in Hibocrates and Galen,
--and he is a knave besides; a cowardly knave as you
would desires to be acquainted withal.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I warrant you, he's the man should fight with him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Aside O sweet Anne Page!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: It appears so by his weapons. Keep them asunder:
here comes Doctor Caius.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter Host, DOCTOR CAIUS, and RUGBY

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, good master parson, keep in your weapon.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: So do you, good master doctor.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Disarm them, and let them question: let them keep
their limbs whole and hack our English.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I pray you, let-a me speak a word with your ear.
Vherefore vill you not meet-a me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS Pray you, use your patience:
in good time.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, you are de coward, de Jack dog, John ape.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS Pray you let us not be
laughing-stocks to other men's humours; I desire you
in friendship, and I will one way or other make you amends.
I will knog your urinals about your knave's cockscomb
for missing your meetings and appointments.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Diable! Jack Rugby,--mine host de Jarteer,--have I
not stay for him to kill him? have I not, at de place
I did appoint?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: As I am a Christians soul now, look you, this is the
place appointed: I'll be judgement by mine host of
the Garter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Peace, I say, Gallia and Gaul, French and Welsh,
soul-curer and body-curer!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, dat is very good; excellent.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Peace, I say! hear mine host of the Garter. Am I
politic? am I subtle? am I a Machiavel? Shall I
lose my doctor? no; he gives me the potions and the
motions. Shall I lose my parson, my priest, my Sir
Hugh? no; he gives me the proverbs and the
no-verbs. Give me thy hand, terrestrial; so. Give me
thy hand, celestial; so. Boys of art, I have
deceived you both; I have directed you to wrong
places: your hearts are mighty, your skins are
whole, and let burnt sack be the issue. Come, lay
their swords to pawn. Follow me, lads of peace;
follow, follow, follow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Trust me, a mad host. Follow, gentlemen, follow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: Aside O sweet Anne Page!

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt SHALLOW, SLENDER, PAGE, and Host

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ha, do I perceive dat? have you make-a de sot of
us, ha, ha?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: This is well; he has made us his vlouting-stog. I
desire you that we may be friends; and let us knog
our prains together to be revenge on this same
scall, scurvy cogging companion, the host of the Garter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By gar, with all my heart. He promise to bring me
where is Anne Page; by gar, he deceive me too.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SIR HUGH EVANS
SPEECH.LINE: Well, I will smite his noddles. Pray you, follow.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A street.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, keep your way, little gallant; you were wont to
be a follower, but now you are a leader. Whether
had you rather lead mine eyes, or eye your master's heels?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROBIN
SPEECH.LINE: I had rather, forsooth, go before you like a man
than follow him like a dwarf.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: O, you are a flattering boy: now I see you'll be a courtier.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Well met, Mistress Page. Whither go you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Truly, sir, to see your wife. Is she at home?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Ay; and as idle as she may hang together, for want
of company. I think, if your husbands were dead,
you two would marry.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Be sure of that,--two other husbands.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Where had you this pretty weather-cock?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: I cannot tell what the dickens his name is my
husband had him of. What do you call your knight's
name, sirrah?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROBIN
SPEECH.LINE: Sir John Falstaff.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Sir John Falstaff!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: He, he; I can never hit on's name. There is such a
league between my good man and he! Is your wife at
home indeed?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Indeed she is.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: By your leave, sir: I am sick till I see her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Has Page any brains? hath he any eyes? hath he any
thinking? Sure, they sleep; he hath no use of them.
Why, this boy will carry a letter twenty mile, as
easy as a cannon will shoot point-blank twelve
score. He pieces out his wife's inclination; he
gives her folly motion and advantage: and now she's
going to my wife, and Falstaff's boy with her. A
man may hear this shower sing in the wind. And
Falstaff's boy with her! Good plots, they are laid;
and our revolted wives share damnation together.
Well; I will take him, then torture my wife, pluck
the borrowed veil of modesty from the so seeming
Mistress Page, divulge Page himself for a secure and
wilful Actaeon; and to these violent proceedings all
my neighbours shall cry aim.
The clock gives me my cue, and my assurance bids me
search: there I shall find Falstaff: I shall be
rather praised for this than mocked; for it is as
positive as the earth is firm that Falstaff is
there: I will go.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, SLENDER, Host, SIR HUGH EVANS, DOCTOR CAIUS, and RUGBY

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Well met, Master Ford.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Trust me, a good knot: I have good cheer at home;
and I pray you all go with me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: I must excuse myself, Master Ford.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: And so must I, sir: we have appointed to dine with
Mistress Anne, and I would not break with her for
more money than I'll speak of.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: We have lingered about a match between Anne Page and
my cousin Slender, and this day we shall have our answer.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SLENDER
SPEECH.LINE: I hope I have your good will, father Page.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: You have, Master Slender; I stand wholly for you:
but my wife, master doctor, is for you altogether.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, be-gar; and de maid is love-a me: my nursh-a
Quickly tell me so mush.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: What say you to young Master Fenton? he capers, he
dances, he has eyes of youth, he writes verses, he
speaks holiday, he smells April and May: he will
carry't, he will carry't; 'tis in his buttons; he
will carry't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Not by my consent, I promise you. The gentleman is
of no having: he kept company with the wild prince
and Poins; he is of too high a region; he knows too
much. No, he shall not knit a knot in his fortunes
with the finger of my substance: if he take her,
let him take her simply; the wealth I have waits on
my consent, and my consent goes not that way.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I beseech you heartily, some of you go home with me
to dinner: besides your cheer, you shall have
sport; I will show you a monster. Master doctor,
you shall go; so shall you, Master Page; and you, Sir Hugh.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SHALLOW
SPEECH.LINE: Well, fare you well: we shall have the freer wooing
at Master Page's.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOCTOR CAIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Go home, John Rugby; I come anon.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Host
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell, my hearts: I will to my honest knight
Falstaff, and drink canary with him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Aside I think I shall drink in pipe wine first
with him; I'll make him dance. Will you go, gentles?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Have with you to see this monster.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A room in FORD'S house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MISTRESS FORD and MISTRESS PAGE

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: What, John! What, Robert!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Quickly, quickly! is the buck-basket--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I warrant. What, Robin, I say!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Come, come, come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Here, set it down.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Give your men the charge; we must be brief.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, as I told you before, John and Robert, be
ready here hard by in the brew-house: and when I
suddenly call you, come forth, and without any pause
or staggering take this basket on your shoulders:
that done, trudge with it in all haste, and carry
it among the whitsters in Datchet-mead, and there
empty it in the muddy ditch close by the Thames side.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: You will do it?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: I ha' told them over and over; they lack no
direction. Be gone, and come when you are called.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Here comes little Robin.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS FORD
SPEECH.LINE: How now, my eyas-musket! what news with you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROBIN
SPEECH.LINE: My master, Sir John, is come in at your back-door,
Mistress Ford, and requests your company.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: You little Jack-a-Lent, have you been true to us?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROBIN
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, I'll be sworn. My master knows not of your
being here and hath threatened to put me into
everlasting liberty if I tell you of it; for he
swears he'll turn me away.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MISTRESS PAGE
SPEECH.LINE: Thou'rt a good boy: this secrecy of thine shall be
a tailor to thee and shall make thee a new doublet
